intro: Camara microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Camara microcephala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
